1/* $NetBSD: timer.h,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:30 riastradh Exp $ */
2
3#ifndef __NVKM_TIMER_H__
4#define __NVKM_TIMER_H__
5#include <core/subdev.h>
6
7struct nvkm_alarm {
8 struct list_head head;
9 struct list_head exec;
10 u64 timestamp;
11 void (*func)(struct nvkm_alarm *);
12};
13
14static inline void
15nvkm_alarm_init(struct nvkm_alarm *alarm, void (*func)(struct nvkm_alarm *))
16{
17 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&alarm->head);
18 alarm->func = func;
19}
20
21struct nvkm_timer {
22 const struct nvkm_timer_func *func;
23 struct nvkm_subdev subdev;
24
25 struct list_head alarms;
26 spinlock_t lock;
27};
28
29u64 nvkm_timer_read(struct nvkm_timer *);
30void nvkm_timer_alarm(struct nvkm_timer *, u32 nsec, struct nvkm_alarm *);
31void nvkm_timer_alarm_cancel(struct nvkm_timer *, struct nvkm_alarm *);
32
33/* Delay based on GPU time (ie. PTIMER).
34 *
35 * Will return -ETIMEDOUT unless the loop was terminated with 'break',
36 * where it will return the number of nanoseconds taken instead.
37 *
38 * NVKM_DELAY can be passed for 'cond' to disable the timeout warning,
39 * which is useful for unconditional delay loops.
40 */
41#define NVKM_DELAY _warn = false;
42#define nvkm_nsec(d,n,cond...) ({ \
43 struct nvkm_device *_device = (d); \
44 struct nvkm_timer *_tmr = _device->timer; \
45 u64 _nsecs = (n), _time0 = nvkm_timer_read(_tmr); \
46 s64 _taken = 0; \
47 bool _warn = true; \
48 \
49 do { \
50 cond \
51 } while (_taken = nvkm_timer_read(_tmr) - _time0, _taken < _nsecs); \
52 \
53 if (_taken >= _nsecs) { \
54 if (_warn) { \
55 dev_warn(_device->dev, "timeout at %s:%d/%s()!\n", \
56 __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__); \
57 } \
58 _taken = -ETIMEDOUT; \
59 } \
60 _taken; \
61})
62#define nvkm_usec(d,u,cond...) nvkm_nsec((d), (u) * 1000, ##cond)
63#define nvkm_msec(d,m,cond...) nvkm_usec((d), (m) * 1000, ##cond)
64
65#define nvkm_wait_nsec(d,n,addr,mask,data) \
66 nvkm_nsec(d, n, \
67 if ((nvkm_rd32(d, (addr)) & (mask)) == (data)) \
68 break; \
69 )
70#define nvkm_wait_usec(d,u,addr,mask,data) \
71 nvkm_wait_nsec((d), (u) * 1000, (addr), (mask), (data))
72#define nvkm_wait_msec(d,m,addr,mask,data) \
73 nvkm_wait_usec((d), (m) * 1000, (addr), (mask), (data))
74
75int nv04_timer_new(struct nvkm_device *, int, struct nvkm_timer **);
76int nv40_timer_new(struct nvkm_device *, int, struct nvkm_timer **);
77int nv41_timer_new(struct nvkm_device *, int, struct nvkm_timer **);
78int gk20a_timer_new(struct nvkm_device *, int, struct nvkm_timer **);
79#endif
80
